alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 7:18PM CDT until June 26 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in North Platte NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... South Platte River near Roscoe affecting Keith and Deuel Counties. .Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall in Colorado continues to flow down the South Platte river. The river will rise steadily and go above flood stage Thursday evening. Additional heavy rainfall upstream is occurring and may affect the current crest forecast. For the South Platte River...including Roscoe...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River near Roscoe. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood Stage. Minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to 9.3 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening to 8.9 feet early Monday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 07/02/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 1215 PM MDT.
